cellularAutomata.rules
Class IntegerRule

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.rules.RuleActions
      cellularAutomata.rules.Rule
          cellularAutomata.rules.IntegerRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.util.EventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
CyclicCATemplate, IntegerMargolusTemplate, IntegerRuleTemplate, IntegerRuleWithCellsTemplate, LifeExtensionsTemplate, MultiGenerationIntegerRuleTemplate, OneDimensionalIntegerMargolusTemplate
public abstract class IntegerRule
extends Rule

A base class for all integer-based rules (not vectors of integers, just single integers).

Author:
David Bahr

Field Detail

MAX_NUM_STATES

public static int MAX_NUM_STATES
The maximum number of permissible states.

MIN_NUM_STATES

public static int MIN_NUM_STATES
The minimum number of permissible states.

DEFAULT_MAX_RULE_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_RULE_SIZE
The default largest size in *digits* for rule numbers. In other words, each rule number can have up to 30000 digits unless another maximum value is set by the user.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

maxRuleSize

public static int maxRuleSize
The largest allowed size in *digits* for rule numbers. In other words, each rule number can have up to 30000 digits unless another maximum value is set by the user (in the System menu). Not recommended that this value be set directly. Instead, let the user set this number from the Systems menu while the application is running.

Constructor Detail

IntegerRule

public IntegerRule(boolean minimalOrLazyInitialization)
Create a rule that is based on integer values.

When building child classes, the minimalOrLazyInitialization parameter must be included but may be ignored. However, the boolean is intended to indicate when the child's constructor should build a rule with as small a footprint as possible. In order to load rules by reflection, the application must query the child classes for information like their display names, tooltip descriptions, etc. At these times it makes no sense to build the complete rule which may have a large footprint in memory.

It is recommended that the child's constructor and instance variables do not initialize any variables and that variables be initialized only when first needed (lazy initialization). Or all initializations in the constructor may be placed in an if statement. 

 if(!minimalOrLazyInitialization)
 {
     ...initialize
 }

Parameters:
minimalOrLazyInitialization - When true, the constructor instantiates an object with as small a footprint as possible. When false, the rule is fully constructed. If uncertain, set this variable to false.
Method Detail

getMinMaxRuleNumberAllowed

public static MinMaxBigIntPair getMinMaxRuleNumberAllowed(java.lang.String latticeDescription,
                                                          java.lang.String ruleDescription,
                                                          int numStates)
Finds the minimum and maximum allowable rule number for the given lattice and rule.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The display name of the lattice for which the min and max rule numbers will be determined.
ruleDescription - The display name of the rule for which the min and max rule numbers will be determined.
numStates - The number of states allowed for a cell on the lattice.
Returns:
The minimum and maximum rule numbers allowed with the specified rule and lattice. Null if this makes no sense for the given rule.

getMinMaxStatesAllowed

public static MinMaxIntPair getMinMaxStatesAllowed(java.lang.String latticeDescription,
                                                   java.lang.String ruleDescription)
Finds the minimum and maximum allowable states for the given lattice and rule. When returns null, then the "Number of States" text field will be disabled.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The display name of the lattice for which the min and max states will be determined.
ruleDescription - The display name of the rule for which the min and max states will be determined.
Returns:
The minimum and maximum number of states allowed with the specified rule and lattice. Null if this makes no sense for the given rule.

getRuleNumberToDisplay

public static java.math.BigInteger getRuleNumberToDisplay(java.lang.String latticeDescription,
                                                          java.lang.String ruleDescription)
Finds the value of the rule number that will be displayed in the "Rule number" text field.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The display name of the lattice for which the rule number will be determined.
ruleDescription - The display name of the rule for which the rule number will be determined.
Returns:
The rule number should be displayed for the "Rule number" text field. When null, will display the value currently in the text field.

getStateValueToDisplay

public static java.lang.Integer getStateValueToDisplay(java.lang.String latticeDescription,
                                                       java.lang.String ruleDescription)
Finds the value of the state that will be displayed in the "Number of States" text field.

Parameters:
latticeDescription - The display name of the lattice for which the state value will be determined.
ruleDescription - The display name of the rule for which the state value will be determined.
Returns:
The state value should be displayed for the "Number of States" text field. When null, will display the value currently in the text field.
